result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquies Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work with no electronic monitoring.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months with the following conditions as to probation:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment, if needed.
*  Pay a fine of $200.00 during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Community service of 40 hours to be done prior to the end of the probationary period.

Court WILL consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Current Pay Statement and Job Summary

Defendant Marquies Gray in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Marquies Gray in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquies Gray in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense requests to set case for a motion hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, state requests to set case for a status conference.  Court orders case adjourned for status conference to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquies Gray in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marquies Gray in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Marquies Gray in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
